title: Infective endocarditis
summary: Infective endocarditis is an infection of the inner surface of the heart, usually the valves.[1] Signs and symptoms may include fever, small areas of bleeding into the skin, heart murmur, feeling tired, and low red blood cell count.[1] Complications may include backward blood flow in the heart, heart failure â€“ the heart struggling to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the body's needs, abnormal electrical conduction in the heart, stroke, and kidney failure.[1][2]
